text: left Deil is a village in the Dutch province of Gelderland. It is a part of the municipality of Geldermalsen, and lies about 12 km west of Tiel. Deil was a separate municipality until 1978, when it became a part of Geldermalsen.Ad van der Meer and Onno Boonstra, "Repertorium van Nederlandse gemeenten", KNAW, 2006. On januari 2019 Deil became part of a newly formed municipality, when the former municipalities of Geldermalsen, Neerijnen and Lingewaal joined together to form the municipality of West-Betuwe. In 2019, the village of Deil had 2.097 inhabitants. The built-up area of the village was 0.38 km², and contained 840 residences.Gemeente Geldermalsen, Gemeente in Cijfers. Retrieved Juli 10, 2018 There is a restored windmill in the village, De Vlinder. ==References== Category:Populated places in Gelderland Category:Former municipalities of Gelderland Category:Geldermalsen
title: Deil
